alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 1:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR LOCATIONS ALONG AND NEAR CARNERO CREEK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, along Carnero Creek between Vernon and Eagar in Apache County. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Carnero Creek and the Little Colorado River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyman Lake State Park and Lyman Lake. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 377 and 382. Highway 180 191 between mile markers 379 and 391. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
